title: Percutaneous Thermal Ablation of Lung Tumors: Comparison of Safety Between Overnight Observation and Same-Day Discharge in Selected Patients.
abstract: Among patients who underwent percutaneous lung tumor thermal ablation and who met standardized criteria evaluated after a 3-hour recovery period, those who underwent in-hospital overnight observation and those who underwent same-day discharge did not show significant differences in major adverse events or hospital readmissions within 30 days.
